clinical_study.brief_title: Effect Of Stretching Programme On Shoulder Performance In Volleyball Players With Posterior Shoulder Tightness
clinical_study.official_title: Effect Of Stretching Programme On Shoulder Performance In Volleyball Players With Posterior Shoulder Tightness

brief_summary.textblock: When the dominant arm is compared with the non-dominant arm in overhead athletes there is a serious internal rotation limitation in the dominant arm. Due to overhead activity, adaptive changes in shoulder joint mobility and flexibility are indicated. Internal rotation limitation is often associated with increased external rotation. One of the reason of this adaptive change is posterior shoulder tightness which is common in overhead athletes as well as in volleyball players. The aim of this study is to determine the effect of stretching program on the range of motion, flexibility of posterior shoulder muscles and functional performance.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in shoulder internal ROM measurement with digital inclometery at 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Passive shoulder internal rotation gain which is measured with digital inclometery

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in muscle hardness (kPA) with elastography at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Elastrography will be used to measure muscle hardness (kPA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in distance scores on single arm shot put test at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Single arm shot put test will be used to assess arm power. Distance will be measured in cm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in velocity (km/h) of spike with radar at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Spike velocity will be measured with radar (km/h)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in strength ( Nm/kg) of shoulder internal rotation and external rotation at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Isokinetic measurements of internal and external shoulder rotation (Nm/kg) at 60 degree/ Sec and 180 degree/ Sec speed will be done.

intervention.description: Stretching exercises will be applied 6 days a week, 30sec / 5 reps

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Posterior shoulder tightness ( 15 degree internal rotation limitation compared with non dominant side)
- Being a professional volleyball player ( at least 3 years experience in the professional league)
- At least having 4 training days in a week
- negative impingement tests ( Hawkins, Neer or Jobe)
- No shoulder pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having any shoulder surgery
- Having a shoulder injury in last 6 months
- Having any neck problem or neck pain
- Having a systemic illness
- Sublocated shoulder
